replies.body:
3% additional damage was what you used to get for 21 points in a tree. 

Just FYI.

Also defensive masteries weren't among the worst in the game. Tanks didn't need broken stuff like CoC to function. They often weren't overbearing either, outside of a few items that were easily tuned.
There were a few OP defensive Masteries in the past, like the % Missing Health Regeneration one.
It wasn't a problem until Riot doubled the regen for no reason.
I'm pretty sure that was one mastery alone?
It was. The cap mastery was a 3% damage increase. The rest were minor attack speed, AP, AD, minor % pen, and various other small perks.

Then your comment's slightly misleading

>3% additional damage was what you used to get for **21 points in a tree.**

All those things you mention does increase damage...
There is a difference in "gives some %ap, so potentially pretty good" and straight "%damage + %damage + %damage" straight up. Very very very different.

You forgot to mention on defense tree you can get a mastery that gives up to 50+ armor and mr when you get hit and %max health shield.

Thats just with 2 points.

Both of those are temporary bonuses while most of the damage amplifications are near constantly active.

While Fearless and Courage of the Colossus are both rather strong, they are pretty much the only useful defensive masteries in the Resolve tree and they are trying to counter-balance the existence of two offensive trees (Ferocity and Cunning).

If the Resolve Tree was better balanced as a whole (or there weren't two full trees of damage amplifiers), those masteries wouldn't need to be quite as powerful to compensate.

You said you can get 26% additional damage, which isn't true. 

The 7% through penetration isn't increasing your damage by 7%, it's making your damage go through either their Armor or Magic Resist by 7%, which doesn't translate to "7% more damage".

I certainly agree that masteries add to much damage amplification, but i still have to say it: 
7% penetration **IS NOT** the same as 7% increased damage !!!

If you are talking EHP, then each point of resistance adds 1% EHP, therefore, 7 armor pen means your target has 7% less physical EHP, and the same goes for MR and magic pen.  In actuality, against targets with 100+ armor/magic resist 7% pen will add more than 7% increased damage after mitigation.

exposed weakness works like this:
you hit a enemy with a damaging ability
and then _an ally_ (and only an ally, you can't trigger the bonus by yourself) can deal 3% increased bonus damage. This lasts for 3 seconds.

now that's fine and dandy, but you included 2% from assassin.

Assassin works like this:
_if no allied champions are near you_, gain 2% increased damage.

which is a bit contradictory. I guess you could have like a xerath across the map trigger it with rite of the arcane (while you are alone beating some guy up), but that's very specific and weird.

also the other increases are somewhat conditional.
bounty hunter is assuming you've killed all 5 enemy champions at least once, sorcery only works on abilities, I don't think %penetration translates equally to a %global damage increase (and it can only boost one damage type magic/physical), and merciless only works on targets below a health threshold.

"The new masteries aren't intended to give -invisible power- or simply -free stats- but to give meaningful choices that compliment what your champion is already doing"

How do you propose that you get the 2% from assassin (which requires you to be alone basically) and get 3% from expose weakness (that requires someone else with the mastery do damage to your target) without them using some long range ability to tag an enemy? Gloabal ADC ults, Lux, Ziggs, Gang P. etc. can help with this. I suspect that when you get Expose W. in most cases you will lose assassin damage.

Bit off on the 7% penetration, which I assume you mean battering blows and piercing thoughts. This is considerably variable. 7% pen vs a target with less than 100 respective resist dosnt get 7% more damage. Where as champs with more than 100 are affected more by this. Infact an ADC with 30 MR has just 2.1 MR penetrated by 7% piercing thoughts.

Im not trying to shit on your point though. I agree that damage creep is a real thing and a bit of a problem... All Im saying is that some of your numbers are a bit fuzzy there.

Lastly, because its not a solid analysis of the numbers just some percents thrown up, some not very accurate, we cant have a real discussion on damage creep based on this post. If the number representation isnt accurate, we wont have a red coming in here making a response because like I did, they will have to spend a lot of time unpacking inaccuracies presented... and theyre not going to bother. Either the presentation is clean and discussion worthy, or it is avoided.

Side note. If I had done a breakdown on damage creep and how masteries have gotten a little to much kill potential in them recently, it would have been like 10 paragraphs with lots of in depth details on various masteries. No one would have read it, much less get 40+ upvotes, so I guess theres that.
